intro: Acinodendron macrote, commonly known as the large-fruited acinodendron, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. The plant is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils.
